creditline: Lent by Temple of Aaron, St. Paul
description: menorah with removable candle cup inserts; scroll designs on arched base with three blue-green gemstones; post extending from base has egg shape below ringed elements with spheres which extend up to candle tray with cups
text: Artisans at Bezalel reintroduced this older form of menorah in the early 20th century. Its use signaled their search for a common, Zionist visual identity for Jews living in Palestine. Bezalel was the name of the artist chosen by God to create the Holy Tabernacle and all of the objects used in it.
title: Menorah
